channel.title: Making a limit on a command
channel.description: Well. I want to make a max withdraw for an item. Because you can withdraw an infinite limit of it and when you type in a number over the highest in the server. It crashes. I know when banking there is a 10 digit limit. I'd like to know how they initialize that limit. I'm adding it to commands.java btw so if I need to import something I can.

item.title: Making a limit on a command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’ll try the first way you suggested.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a limit on a command

item.title: Making a limit on a command
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

K where it has this
String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString();
Just add this

	if(Integer.parseInt(playerCommand) >= Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
	    c.sendMessage("The input you tried to enter was way over the max.");
	    return;
	}

eh not the best way…

Or you can add it into the bankx1 file and crap like that since it’s already parsed into an int.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a limit on a command

item.title: Making a limit on a command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I just want to know how to call the max limit into the command so you can’t go past it and crash my server.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a limit on a command

item.title: Making a limit on a command
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

zyle1992:

Its not a limit based on the amount of digits, but rather the size of the data that holds it. The usual amount is defined as an int which means that value is 2^32 - 1

It’s actually 2^31 - 1.

Integer.MAX_VALUE

Read full topic
item.source: Making a limit on a command

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well yes I know the max limit is a few hundred k after 2147m. But in my server if you go to bank. And hold down the 1 key. It stops after 10 digits. The interface I am using in another commands has no limit.
